etymologies: early 17th century (in an earlier sense). From Middle French, French pensionnaire, †pensionaire person who receives a pension, pupil in a boarding school, person who boards in a lodging house, junior member of the Comédie Française from pension + -aire. Compare post-classical Latin pensionarius

definitions: In France and other European countries: a person who boards in a lodging house or institution, or with a family.
A junior member of the Comédie Française.
